Package com.example.lotteryevent.viewmodels

Class OrganizerEventViewModel

java.lang.Object
androidx.lifecycle.ViewModel
com.example.lotteryevent.viewmodels.OrganizerEventViewModel
public class OrganizerEventViewModel extends androidx.lifecycle.ViewModel
ViewModel for the OrganizerEventFragment.

This class is responsible for preparing and managing the data for the organizer's event detail screen. It retrieves data from the IOrganizerEventRepository, processes it to determine the UI state, and exposes it to the Fragment via LiveData. It is designed to be testable by allowing repository injection.

    • loadEvent

      public void loadEvent(String eventId)
      Initiates the process of fetching the event details, capacity status, and entrants from the repository.
      Parameters:
      eventId - The unique identifier for the event to load.

    • updateEventPoster

      public void updateEventPoster(String eventId, String posterImageUrl)
      Updates the event poster image (Base64) for the given event.
      Parameters:
      eventId - The ID of the event to update.
      posterImageUrl - The Base64-encoded poster image data.

    • generateQrCode

      public void generateQrCode(String eventId)
      Generates a QR Code bitmap from the eventId and posts it to the _qrCodeBitmap LiveData.
      Parameters:
      eventId - The text content to encode in the QR code.

    • onQrCodeShown

      public void onQrCodeShown()
      Should be called by the Fragment after the QR code has been displayed.

    • finalizeEvent

      public void finalizeEvent(String eventId)
      Triggers the event finalization process in the repository. The repository will handle the logic of checking if the user is the organizer.
      Parameters:
      eventId - The ID of the event to finalize.

    • generateEntrantCsv

      public void generateEntrantCsv()
      Transforms the current list of entrants into a CSV string. The result is posted to _csvContent.

    • onCsvExported

      public void onCsvExported()
      Resets the CSV content LiveData. Call this after the Fragment has successfully handled the file save to prevent re-saving on configuration changes.

    • onCleared

      protected void onCleared()
      This method is called when the ViewModel is no longer used and will be destroyed. It's crucial to clean up observers registered with `observeForever` to prevent memory leaks.
      Overrides:
      onCleared in class androidx.lifecycle.ViewModel
